intro: Aegiphila, commonly known as the false geranium, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Lamiaceae. These plants are native to the Americas, particularly South America, and are often found in dry, rocky habitats. They typically have aromatic leaves and produce small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. Aegiphila species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Their compact growth habit and ornamental value make them popular in gardens and landscapes.
